text: :two: Team will try to minimize the custom css/styling and see how well that renders with existing style elements in `seven` and `claro` -- most likely they may also need to make merge requests against seven and claro as well, just to ensure things look okay.

text: <https://www.drupal.org/project/announce/issues/3236291#comment-14228171>

attachments.title: Module Rename
attachments.text: As andrewmacpherson suggested in the MR. It would be great if we could rename the module coz its library may be confused with the Drupal.announce. Current suggestion is to rename from announce to announcement.

text: In particular, the minimal styling we *do* ship with will follow <@U1ET7192M>'s guidance from this comment: <https://www.drupal.org/project/drupal/issues/3206643#comment-14221002>

text: <@U21M96DQU> done with the changes.... How about a final review :smile:

elements.text: done with the changes.... How about a final review

text:
The items I am aware from reading back through seem to be:
• icon should support forced color mode - and should be switched to svg anyway - mock in ckrina's comment in the issue
• the links should appear as blue underlined links in the *minimal* styling, and should match the style guide for seven and claro implementations
• The links *should not* be forced to target=blank_ for screen reader reasons
• The color contrast should be improved
• The 'sticky' posts should be clearly readable as sticky by screen readers as well, and not just rely on a background color change or other visual change
• We should consider making the 'learn more' link/button appear on every feed item, and distinguish sticky items some other way - a class for screen readers + a different background color, or some kind of 'pin' icon for sticky, or something else? 
Finally the only item that I'm not sure got a final answer:
• Do we want to use the off-canvas dialogue to have the announcement feed *pop over* the content *OR* open a sidebar drawer like it does now? (mimicking settings tray?)

the links should appear as blue underlined links in the
minimal
styling, and should match the style guide for seven and claro implementations
The links
should not
be forced to target=blank_ for screen reader reasons
The color contrast should be improved
The 'sticky' posts should be clearly readable as sticky by screen readers as well, and not just rely on a background color change or other visual change

We should consider making the 'learn more' link/button appear on every feed item, and distinguish sticky items some other way - a class for screen readers + a different background color, or some kind of 'pin' icon for sticky, or something else?
Finally the only item that I'm not sure got a final answer:
Do we want to use the off-canvas dialogue to have the announcement feed
pop over
the content
OR
open a sidebar drawer like it does now? (mimicking settings tray?)
